result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Tyler Lepper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. 
**Court orders weapons in Count 3 are to be forfeited and destroyed.**
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Tyler Lepper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:45 am case called. Defendant Zachary Tyler Lepper in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached on the record.  State moves to amend count 1 to Possess Illegally obtained Rx w/o a valid Rx in violation of 450.11(7)(h) & (9)(a) of the pharmacy code.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts amendment of Count 1 by the State.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Court dismisses and reads-in Count 3 & 4 and 16TR302.  No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months. Credit for 1 days served if revoked. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court directs forfeiture and destruction of weapons in Count 3.  Court orders bond on file to be applied. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Pre-trial conference at 03-03-2016 10:30 am.
Status conference at 03-28-2016 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 16CF-28 and 16TR-302 - Both Cases Called @ 2:22 PM: Defendant Zachary Tyler Lepper in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Court explains right to counsel.  Defendant does not wish to have counsel today and wishes to speak with the DA on resolution.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary Tyler Lepper
Current: 118 Courtney Ln, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 02-11-2016)
Prior: 1548 Collins St, Neenah, WI 54956

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons, including any firearms - no device that is capable of causing harm to himself of another.

Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant Zachary Tyler Lepper in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Zachary Tyler Lepper in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility will be determined by custody status.  DA argues for cash bond w/condition.  SPD argues as to bond request and would argue for lower cash or signature bond.   Court orders $350 cash bond with conditions.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
